name: Sepia Tears
description: A visual novel about a memory that a boy named Mark tries very hard to forget, and a girl named Myra who unearths it.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: 1.2 GHz Pentium 4 Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: 800 x 600 DirectX: Version 10 Storage: 500 MB available space

reviews.review_text: A lovely story with an interesting twist (won’t be saying more so as not to spoil it ~_^ ). I fully recommend it to everyone who likes VNs, especially since this gem is free.

Don't let the little amount of hours confuse i've beaten this game when it was first up on desura and played it a bit of its phone port (or maybe thats where it came from the start idk)  this has to my favourite visual novels and i hope bringing it to steam has given the devs some kind of motavation (cause they went very unactive on desure with some of them haven't come online for almost a year since that game was released on the 24th of december 2013.  i like the fact that this game has gotten steam achivements which gives me more insentive to delete all of my saves and restart the game, trading cards would also be nice i'd love to see what kind of emotes and backround i could get (along with braging that this is the best game ever) but i'll hold my breath as to not be disapponted.  i'm very supirsed that this game didn't cost money, even though this game is free on desure and the google play store (not sure about IOS) this game has the quality to have a price 1.99$,5.99$,10.99$ or whatever other price it has.  One more thing that kind of throws me off is that on desure the game was devloped and published by Team Neet and on steam its devolped and published by Scarlet String Studios this could be the devs changing there names or someone else just throwing the game up on steam(which is a low thing to do)  But to end this review off on a high note of your a fan of visual novels and you'd like to play a game thats not just a panty shot fest like the sakura games and you want a deep compeling story i would pick this game up.

First of all, this game is free, so the question is whether the time spent is worth it. To fully explore the content took me about 2.5 hours, and that was definitely worth it for me.  + Attractive art - While the artwork is not the highest quality, it does its job well + Solid story - I found myself sympathizing with the characters and fairly invested in figuring out what was going on + Good writing (mostly) - The stream of consciousness was easy to follow and conversations flowed naturally (or didn't flow naturally as the story required!) + Pleasant music + Easy achievements (if you are into that)  - Redundancy - Some conversations are repetitive and I found myself starting to just skim a bit in some sections. - Ending - While I personally enjoyed the ending, some might find the endings unsatisfactory for a VN. I don't really want to say more for spoiler purposes.  Overall I enjoyed my time with Sepia Tears. The more you enjoy VNs and anime the more you'll like this game.

Playing this VN made me feel what the protagonist was feeling: The joy of love, the pain of rejection and the fear of experiencing it all over again.   Enough of my nonexistant lovelife, time for my review  I'll get to the point, this VN is lovely. Story-wise I love it, it could have been longer though. But nonetheless it was really good. It was so good that I was able to feel and somehow relive the events of the game based on some points of my life. The art was nice for me, although at some points it seemed off. The music was lovely, it really helped in setting the mood of the game. The characters were great, for some reason I could relate to their emotions and struggles, the pain they felt deep inside. I really felt as if I was them at some point.  All in all, I really enjoyed this VN.  You should pick it up too *it's free!* And if you do pick it up, may I suggest that you buckle up since you will be on the feel's trip

Sepia tears is just an awesome VN it might lack some logic lack some deep revealing points might be hard to keep up with the flow of thoughts and the alternate between jokes and serious drama talks yet you can barely keep up with it and that’s too great point in it .... it just lets you feel challenging ...... and it takes some damn believe in what u chose and .... it just has romance logic with some real touching words and sentences ..... just awesome for me even if it lacks the voice actors, the BGMs at some points are great ... that's all … now to some serious review: One has to put in mind that this is a FREE VN which means you never compare it with some masterpieces that are about 40 or 70 dollars. Character designs are good to some point they do have some small details yet they still feel like kind of old, the backgrounds in the game are some pictures that were made to look like cartoon or anime like still there are some good looking ones in them too. Let’s talk about the story …. It might feel boring at some points but they will be fast you will never feel like oh god I’m out of this, there are some truly great words and whole sentences filled with some logic or like a good talk about what almost every teenager felt in is life or in some relationship he went through or thought of going throw it. Now to something really made me write this review … it’s the that this VN makes you feel about choosing what to do it tells you that if you truly know what happened and did search for the clues in the characters’ speeches AND most importantly that you do believe in those things … they are the pride of a VN reader the things that should always have trust in … I’m touched by this thing …… REMEMBER IT’S A FREE VN NOT A PAID ONE.  ONE last thing .... don't mind looking at the achivements they don't spoil the game but you don't have to hunt them before you finish the VN ~_^

Sepia Tears is a F2P Visual Novel which has a rather romantic plot structure to it. The story is perhaps one of the best I have seen in while, at most times remaining cryptic and mysterious until the final part of the game came around. Now not giving much away about the ending but I personally found it very satisfying and the build up really made you emotionally invested in the protagonist so it made the ending that much more impacful. The game takes around 4-5 hours to complete depending on how fast you read and what choices you make. Now I have only played through this once and got the good ending, but I am assuming there are some other (worse?) ones (When I play a VN that is heavy in the feels, I tend not to even look up nor play the bad endings). Overall this game has a solid story, a solid soundtrack, and solid artwork, A must play for any visual novel fan, and hey its free (which is actually rather suprising for a game this refined).  Verdict: 7.5/10  Now please excuse me as I take heat from all the people on my friends list calling me a weaboo for playing anything that remotely contains anime.

I read this story on Android during some flights. It doesn't take long to blast through and I found it entertaining. Some characters will come off as cliche but there is almost always a chilling twist that makes them more fleshed out. The jokes are over the top and quite a few will come out of nowhere. The art is charming and colorful, if simple, and the soundtrack fits the scenes. Key moments boast with much appreciated details.  Slight SPOILERS about the genre and subject matter at hand: This VN is a dash of psychological horror, dealing with how assumptions may seem safe but not necessarily be in line with our world, and most terrifying of all,    rejection   . The characters reach catharsis by    facing their fears and embracing to be honest and sticking to being honest.     The VN's spirit is a bit on the naive side, but it's something you'll want to forgive it with a hug.  Give it a shot!

It's free to play why would I complain?

So, basically completed the game.  And I must say, for a free visual novel this was actually pretty good. Sure, not a masterpiece, or that original (because of certain cliche characters, scenarios, etc.), but it has a very interesting appeal to it.   Basically this is a story about romance, not weird aliens, or time travel, or ghosts - just a simple storybook romance with a twist (which you probably will see coming). Its refreshing, if I could say so myself.  I'd recommend playing it, it is not that long, and if you read fast - even shorter. The story really is what keeps you going and clicking for more. Initially I just wanted to get the achievments and kill time, but got attached to a certain character, in whose ending I was not disappointed one bit.  All in all, kudos to the developers.

As an avid watcher of Anime myself, I love games based upon the looks of Anime. I haven't played many visual novels, but seeing how people were talking about this game in the Steam reviews sparked my interest. I gave it a look and completed it 100% and I have to say this was a real roller-coaster ride. If you've never played/not played much visual novels this is a great place to start. I won't say too much but the story involves a character who is scarred from an event that happened in his life. He tries to forget what happened and continues to live his life till cruel fate catches up to him and reminds him you can't forget everything. That is the base of the whole plot, the rest you can find out yourself. And a little bit of warning, don't read too much on this game. You'll probably get spoiled by a jerk who finds it funny to ruin a beautfiul game that was made by someone who put their soul into making it, just a heads up... The characters have character. the artwork is downright charming (And gorgeous), the music is fantastic, and this game will make you feel emotions you never knew you could feel. Overall, I definitely recommend this game. And it has sparked my new-found love for visual novels.      RogueTom gives this game a     9/10

By far one of my favorites, something about its simplicirty combined with its meaning. Also, Myra really evokes a certain emotion, something between the lines of safety, comfort, and love. Her stalker-ish ways make you feel like she is always watching you (for better or worse), hey methods and witty comments really give a sense of comfort and friendliness, like you want to be around her, like she's an old friend. Rin is very creatively made to be a reflection in ways to Mark, and both Lucas and Lillian help give Mark (You) a better perspective of what's happening, and help altogether bring the story together. Also the whole thing takes place in a week, so, that's convenient.

It's fine.  It's free.   Art ranges from actually very good with nice camera pans and zooms, to lazy or even terrible.  The story is very lacklustre; the sister could have been cut from the entire story with no problem, and saved on the length of the story. The set-up ends up being around 90% of the story, with only a final 10% pay-off.  It desperately needs an editor, and a commitment to making the art as good as it can be (and in some scenes, it is).  It is, however, free.
